items.title: Alberta premier confirms plans to allow surgeons to work in both public and private health care systems
items.summary_auto: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has confirmed her government's intention to allow physicians flexibility to work in both the public and private health care systems.

items.title: Ophthalmologists urge provinces not to allow optometrists to perform minor surgeries
items.summary_auto: Ophthalmologists are urging provincial governments not to move ahead with plans that would allow optometrists to perform some surgeries and laser eye treatments, which are currently outside their scope of practice.

items.title: Ophthalmologists raise safety concerns as provinces weigh allowing optometrists to perform minor surgeries
items.summary_auto: Ophthalmologists are urging provincial governments not to move ahead with plans that would allow optometrists to perform some surgeries and laser eye treatments, which are currently outside their scope of practice.

items.title: Winnipeg police announce arrest in arson cases
Israeli airstrikes kill 25 Palestinians in Gaza, rattling ceasefire, health officials say
items.summary_auto: At least 25 Palestinians were killed in four Israeli airstrikes on Wednesday in a part of Gaza under Hamas control since a shaky ceasefire took effect in October, health authorities said.

items.title: What would it take for Canadians to eat less ultra-processed foods?
items.summary_auto: Researchers have linked ultra-processed foods to chronic diseases like obesity, Type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular diseases. But helping Canadians make healthier choices comes with obstacles, experts say.

items.title: ‘Mind-blowing’ population of feral goldfish in Ottawa pond to be euthanized
items.summary_auto: The City of Ottawa is preparing to euthanize a school of invasive goldfish in a stormwater pond near the Central Experimental Farm — though a local fish scientist warns the city may be vastly underestimating the scale of the problem.

items.title: Another Canadian joins Gretzky, Crosby as lone NHL teens with 30 points in first 20 games of a season
items.summary_auto: Three goals on Tuesday night gave San Jose Sharks forward Macklin Celebrini 30 points in his team's first 20 games of a season, a mark reached only by two other teenagers in NHL history, Wayne Gretzky and Sidney Crosby.

items.title: Justice system betrays sexual violence survivors, says federal advocate for victims of crime
items.summary_auto: A report from Canada’s victims of crime advocate says survivors of sexual violence are being systemically betrayed by the criminal justice system, as allegations are disbelieved and cases are regularly delayed or dropped.

items.title: Teen turns himself in, charged with murder after Belinda Sarkodie shot at Hamilton bus stop in July
items.summary_auto: A 17-year-old turned himself in to Hamilton police and has been arrested and charged in the death of Belinda Sarkodie, police announced Wednesday. The 26-year-old innocent bystander was waiting at a bus stop on July 11 when gunfire ensued.

items.title: Pope Leo, Catholic bishops come out against 'vilification' of immigrants in U.S.
items.summary_auto: Pope Leo has come out in support of a rare special message released by the U.S. Conference of Catholic Bishops in recent days that lamented a "climate of fear and anxiety around questions of profiling and immigration enforcement."

items.title: For the first time, the woman Jacob Hoggard was convicted of sexually assaulting is revealing her identity
PWHL's 3rd season features growth and Olympics as league grows to 8 teams
items.summary_auto: The PWHL's two newest teams, the Vancouver Goldeneyes and Seattle Torrent, both look to be contenders for the Walter Cup in their first season.

items.title: Former U.S. treasury secretary Larry Summers quits OpenAI board over Epstein emails
items.summary_auto: Former U.S. treasury secretary Larry Summers is resigning from OpenAI’s board of directors, the ChatGPT maker and his office said Wednesday.

items.title: Stock market rises as investors wait on Nvidia earnings report
items.summary_auto: The U.S. stock market is rising on Wednesday, for now at least, ahead of a huge couple of tests for Wall Street.

items.title: Poland set to charge 2 Ukrainians with sabotage of terrorist nature for railway explosion
items.summary_auto: Polish authorities plan to charge two Ukrainians with sabotage of a terrorist nature on behalf of Russia over an explosion that damaged a train track used for deliveries to Ukraine, prosecutors said Wednesday.

items.title: Border guard used service weapon to gun down ex-fiancée in Prince Rupert, B.C., CBC learns
items.summary_auto: CBC News has learned new details about the 2022 homicide in northwestern B.C., including what the murder weapon was, how it was accessed, and the recommendations around CBSA officers’ mental health that have been made since.

items.title: Israeli military carries out powerful strikes on 2 southern Lebanon villages
items.summary_auto: The Israeli military carried out powerful airstrikes in two villages in southern Lebanon on Wednesday, witnesses said, pressing a campaign of near-daily attacks in the border region where Israel says it is targeting Hezbollah.

items.title: Alberta already has sky-high car insurance rates. Will 120 km/h speed limits send premiums higher?
items.summary_auto: Vehicle insurance companies are going to keep a close watch on whether the Alberta government keeps driving forward with a proposal to increase some highway speed limits to 120km/h.

items.title: Online scams on the rise as holidays approach, security experts warn
items.summary_auto: With Black Friday and Cyber Monday fast approaching, security experts are warning people to be careful when buying online.

items.title: The numbers don't lie: The struggle is real for Gen Z students
items.summary_auto: High tuition, rent and unemployment rates mean getting by as a Gen Z student is difficult. But do they have it the worst?

items.title: Heavy Russian attack on Ukraine kills at least 25 people, injures around 80, officials say
items.summary_auto: At least 25 people were killed in a Russian drone and missile attack overnight that hit apartment buildings in the western Ukrainian city of Ternopil, Ukrainian officials said on Wednesday.

items.title: Looming military radar project creates deep anxiety for rural Ontario community
items.summary_auto: Family farms in Clearview Township, Ont., face uncertainty after the Department of National Defence proposed a $38-billion NORAD radar project. Generations of farmers fear losing land to the military, raising tension between national security plans and rural heritage.

items.title: The people who inspire CBC Massey Lecturer Alex Neve to fight for human rights
items.summary_auto: When he was eight, 2025 CBC Massey Lecturer Alex Neve watched his mother fight for daycare in Alberta. It’s shaped how he thinks about human rights. The Canadian lawyer shares the pivotal moments in his life that led to his human rights advocacy — and shines a light on the chorus of people he carries with him.

items.title: Carney heads to U.A.E. hoping to sign investment pact with gulf nation
items.summary_auto: Prime Minister Mark Carney is slated to meet with United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan in Abu Dhabi with the explicit focus on expanding the Canada-U.A.E. economic partnership in key sectors such as energy, agriculture, infrastructure and AI.

items.title: I believed in achieving goals. Living with a concussion forced me to appreciate the journey
items.summary_auto: Paleontologist Natalia Rybczynski studies the ancient animals of Canada’s High Arctic. After experiencing a brain injury in 2011, she had to figure out life again.

items.title: 16 going on 60: How well has The Sound of Music aged?
items.summary_auto: This year marks the 60th anniversary of the film adaptation of The Sound of Music. Decades on, fans and critics alike are revisiting the film and reconsidering its legacy as well as what it has to say about the world today.

items.title: 1 of 25 students abducted in Nigeria found safe as search continues for missing girls
items.summary_auto: A schoolgirl who was abducted with 24 others from a dormitory in northwestern Nigeria has escaped and is safe, the school's principal told The Associated Press on Tuesday, as hunters joined security forces in the search for the missing students in forests close to the school.
